(Original) Honestly the worst customer service experience I have ever had - 100 EUROS WAS TAKEN FROM MY ACCOUNT BY ORANGE AND I RECEIVED NO CREDIT IN RETURN. I tried to recharge online multiple times and each time I got a notification informing me that the transaction hadn't worked.  I also got an email each time from Orange informing me that the transaction hadn't worked, my phone would not be credited and my card WOULD NOT BE CHARGED. After this, I received an email from my bank informing me that my card had been blocked due to suspicious transactions. It turned out that each attempt at recharging online had actually resulted in money being taken from my account despite the notice on the website and email both confirming that the transaction had been cancelled and I would not be charged.  I went into Orange Opera today to remedy the situation and was told they couldn't help me and I had to call a helpline. After calling the helpline I was similarly informed I couldn't be helped there and had to go in store. I asked someone at the Orange store if I could speak to a more senior person who could potentially help me - I was informed that the manager was away and no one was in charge???. Eventually they sat me down with someone to help (AFTER 40 MINUTES of being there)  I WAS THEN ESSENTIALLY ACCUSED OF STEALING. When I gave them my phone number for them to "help" me figure out what had occurred, the name that appeared on their screen was not mine. After a verification and looking at the sim number they eventually figured out it was in fact mine...  I explained for the 6th time to the man who was "helping" me that my bank had cancelled my card due to the 11 TRANSACTIONS that had gone out of my account in rapid succession to Orange and that I would like a refund. I explained that I DIDN'T WANT TO PAY FOR MORE CREDIT AFTER ALREADY PAYING 100 EUROS FOR NOTHING. He said okay come with me - I took this to mean he was finally going to help me. He loaded 10 euros of credit onto my card and I thanked him a lot. However, he then said YOU HAVE TO PAY 10 EUROS NOW. I told him I had just told him I wasn't prepared to pay more after so much money had already been taken and further that I COULDN'T PAY AS MY CARD HAD BEEN SUSPENDED by my bank due to Orange's error. He then began to yell at me while I stood there. Other employees looked over with disinterest (perhaps yelling at customers is a common occurrence at Orange?? - a friend had recently had a similar experience at the Champs-Elysee store where they charged her twice and then yelled in her face after she asked for assistance to correct the situation). Luckily, I had a friend who was there to help me pay but I am completely unsure what I would've been able to do in that situation if I didn't have them to pay for me.   No one could give me any advice as to how I get the money back and I leave the country in a few days. So Orange has essentially stolen 100 euros from me....Could not recommend Orange less to anyone - their staff are rude and aggressive and they have taken my money with no indication of how I can get it back. Other providers offer cheaper options with less of a hassle so I would recommend going with them.
